title: Citi Collaborates with PMN and IFC to Launch a Disaster and Risk Management Series for the Microfinance Sector
summary: Citi Pakistan, in collaboration with the Pakistan Microfinance Network (PMN), launched a three-day seminar and workshop on Risk Management (RM) as part of Citi Foundation's support to disaster relief in the aftermath of Pakistan's floods. This series, led by Christian Ruehmer, a leading expert for Risk Management for the International Financial Corporation (IFC) in the area of Risk Management, will conclude with a joint research publication in collaboration with IFC and Consultative Group to Assist the Poor (CGAP) to be disseminated as a best practice for lessons learned by the microfinance sector during disasters.
tag-1: Citi Collaborates with PMN and IFC to Launch a Disaster and Risk Management Series for the Microfinance Sector
tag-2: Citi Pakistan, in collaboration with the Pakistan Microfinance Network (PMN), launched a three-day seminar and workshop on Risk Management (RM) as part of Citi Foundation's support to disaster relief in the aftermath of Pakistan's floods. This series, led by Christian Ruehmer, a leading expert for Risk Management for the International Financial Corporation (IFC) in the area of Risk Management, will conclude with a joint research publication in collaboration with IFC and Consultative Group to Assist the Poor (CGAP) to be disseminated as a best practice for lessons learned by the microfinance sector during disasters.
tag-3: The training is a comprehensive course aimed at intellectual capacity-building of the microfinance sector to manage the various risks faced by their institutions. There is also a special focus on managing liquidity risks in disaster situations as the risk management workshop has been funded by the Citi Foundation as part of the Flood Initiative to support the microfinance sector in Pakistan.
tag-4: The seminar was opened by Hashim Jawan Bakht, Citi Pakistan's Vice President and Corporate Bank Head for the North Region. In his introductory remarks, Bakht spoke of Citi's longstanding relationship with PMN, which began in November 2007 with the three-year Citi Network Strengthening Program. With Citi's support, PMN has been able to set up industry infrastructure for knowledge management and information-sharing through its two online products. PMN also has established a credit bureau, which will help in improving information symmetries at the client level. PMN has developed links with academic institutions to help in providing good quality HR for the industry and is also engaged in building links with the media to remove misconceptions surrounding microfinance.
tag-5: Citi's Country Officer Arif Usmani said, "Our partnership with PMN has played a vital role in strengthening the capacity-building of the microfinance sector in Pakistan. In addition, we have collaborated with PMN in the aftermath of last year's catastrophic floods to support risk mitigation efforts for the microfinance sector. This training program will conclude with a best practice research note on lessons learned from recent disasters, so as to enable the sector to preempt risks in the future. As we celebrate our 50th year in the country this year, we are now proud to announce a new partnership based on a Citi Foundation grant to PMN for conducting the first national study on the social impact of microfinance in Pakistan."
tag-6: The workshop, conducted by the IFC, is designed to support Microfinance Practitioners (MFPs) in a self assessment of the status of risk management as well as to implement organizational improvements. During the three-day seminar, the participants will learn about the general approach to risk management in all relevant risk categories for MFPs, including credit, market, liquidity, and operational risk.
tag-7: Christian Ruehmer, the workshop trainer, is a Lead Expert for Risk Management for the IFC in the area of Risk Management, where he steered the development of the Toolkit for Risk Management for MFIs. He has been involved in microfinance since 2001 and has worked with more than 50 MFIs and organizations in Latin America, Europe, Africa, and Asia.
tag-8: As Citi Pakistan completes 50 years in the country (1961-2011), it continues to focus on developing microfinance as a tool for financial inclusion in the community through a series of programs based on Citi Foundation funding. The Foundation has committed new funding to PMN for the first national social impact study on the MF sector, as well as US$20,000 to the Akhuwat Foundation for an interest-free microentrepreneurship program specifically for female entrepreneurs in Pakistan to help them set up their businesses. This year also marks the completion of Citi's microfinance flood rehabilitation program with the Pakistan Poverty Alleviation Fund for enabling vulnerable groups (particularly disabled groups, widows and the ultra-poor impacted by the floods last year) to regain their livelihoods.
